articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Special Envoy Arrives in Moscow
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Special Envoy Arrives in Moscow
 Moscow, November 17 (KCNA Correspondent) -- Choe Ryong Hae, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, arrived in Moscow Monday by special plane to visit the Russian Federation as a special envoy of supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					 Also arriving here were Kim Kye Gwan, first vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, No Kwang Chol, vice-chief of the General Staff of the Korean People's Army, Ri Yong Chol, vice department director of the Central Committee of the WPK, Ri Kwang Gun, vice-minister of External Economic Relations, who are special envoy's party and officials concerned.
					
					 They were greeted at an airport by officials concerned of the Russian Foreign Ministry and Kim Hyong Jun, DPRK ambassador to Russia.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju Greets Bulgarian PM
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju Greets Bulgarian PM
 Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju on Monday sent a congratulatory message to Boyko Borisov upon his appointment as prime minister of the Republic of Bulgaria.
					 The message wished the prime minister success in his responsible work for the development and prosperity of the country, expressing the belief that the bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation would grow stronger.
					
					 Meanwhile, DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong sent a similar message to Daniel Mitov upon his appointment as foreign minister of Bulgaria.

articles.title: Statues Erected at Security University
articles.content:
Statues Erected at Security University
 Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- Statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il were erected at the Security University of the DPRK.
					 An unveiling ceremony took place on Tuesday.
					
					 Present there were Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Pak To Chun, Kim Won Hong, Jo Yon Jun, and commanding officers of the Ministry of State Security, officials of security organs at various levels and teachers, students and employees of the university and their families and officials and those of meritorious services of units which contributed to erecting the statues.
					
					 The statues were unveiled by leading officials of the party and army and officials of the university.
					
					 After the statues were unveiled, they shed bright rays.
					
					 Laid before the statues was a floral basket in the name of supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also placed there were floral baskets in the joint name of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, the Central Military Commission of the WPK and the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and in the name of the Ministry of State Security and security organs and units at various levels.
					
					 All the participants paid high tribute to the statues in humble reverence.
					
					 General of the Korean People's Army Kim Won Hong, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and minister of State Security, made an address.
					
					 The erection of the statues is a great event demonstrating the faith and will of all service personnel and people to accomplish the cause of Mt. Paektu by giving steady continuity to the lineage of Juche and another great revolutionary jubilee in giving steady continuity to the history of the cause of immortalizing the leaders, the speaker said, and went on:
					
					 Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il were founder and builder of the Juche- based security organ as they gave the origin to the building of the most popular and original security organ, the first of its kind in history, and wisely led the state security work.
					
					 Respected Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un, who is carrying forward and developing the Juche-based security idea and leadership feats of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, has shown all sorts of loving care and benevolence for the security officers so that they could creditably discharge their honorable mission in the general advance for the final victory of the Songun revolution.
					
					 The speaker called upon all the security officers and teachers and students of the university to build security organs and conduct their activities the way Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il did under any circumstances and discharge their sacred mission and duty as the security corps of the leaders and the supreme commander in any storm and stress, bearing in mind the fixed faith that Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il are always with them.
					
					 The participants were briefed on the statues before going round them.

articles.title: Joint Event Held to Mark Anniversary of Start of Tour of Mt. Kumgang
articles.content:
Joint Event Held to Mark Anniversary of Start of Tour of Mt. Kumgang
 Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- A joint event took place at the Special Zone for International Tour of Mt. Kumgang on Tuesday to mark the 16th anniversary of the start of tour of Mt. Kumgang.
					 Present there from the DPRK side were Won Tong Yon, vice-chairman of the Korea Asia-Pacific Peace Committee, and officials concerned and from the south side were Hyon Jong Un, chairperson of Hyundai Group, and leading officers of Hyundai Group and Hyundai Asan.
					
					 The participants laid bouquets before the monument to the autograph of leader Kim Jong Il and paid tribute to him.
					
					 Jo Kon Sik, manager of the Stock Company of Hyundai Asan, and Hwang Ho Yong, director of the Guidance Bureau for the Special Zone for International Tour of Mt. Kumgang, made speeches.
					
					 The speakers recalled that Kim Jong Il paved the way for south Koreans to tour Mt. Kumgang, adding that as a result, tour boat Kumgang anchored at Jangjon Port at Mt. Kumgang resort for the first time on Nov. 18, Juche 87 (1998), after crossing the extension of the Military Demarcation Line in the East Sea of Korea. 
					
					 They also referred to the facts that since then many south Koreans of all social standings toured Mt. Kumgang and that Kim Jong Il showed particular loving care for the family of Hyundai Group.
					
					 Marshal Kim Jong Un is paying deep attention to Hyundai Group and the tour of Mt. Kumgang, they said, calling upon the north and the south to pool their efforts to ensure that the tour of Mt. Kumgang resumed as soon as possible.
					
					 The participants jointly planted trees on that occasion and those concerned of the Hyundai side went round facilities at Mt. Kumgang resort.

articles.title: DPRK Weightlifters Back Home
articles.content:
DPRK Weightlifters Back Home
 Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- DPRK weightlifters and their coaches came back home on Tuesday after proving successful in the 2014 World Weightlifting Championship. 
					 They were greeted at Pyongyang Railway Station by Kim Su Gil, chief secretary of the Pyongyang City Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Yong Hun, minister of Physical Culture and Sports, Choe Yong Nam, director of the General Bureau of Public Service who is chairman of the Weightlifting Association, officials concerned and sportspersons.
					
					 When the bus carrying them passed along streets, Pyongyangites congratulated them on their spectacular successes in the championship.
					
					 They visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill to pay floral tribute to them.

articles.title: DPRK Wins 12 Gold Medals at World Weightlifting Championship
articles.content:
DPRK Wins 12 Gold Medals at World Weightlifting Championship
 Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- The DPRK came first in the country standing of the 2014 World Weightlifting Championship, bagging 12 gold medals.
					 Competitions were made in 15 categories of weights (men's eight and women's seven) for a total of 45 gold medals at the championship.
					
					 Om Yun Chol of the Amnokgang Sports Team grabbed the first gold medals for the DPRK in men's 56kg weightlifting event and thus became a two-time world champion.
					
					 Kim Un Guk of the April 25 Sports Team, who renewed world records at the 17th Asian Games, won three gold medals in men's 62kg while Ryo Un Hui took the first place in women's 69kg snatch, jerk and total.
					
					 Besides, Ri Jong Hwa and Kim Kwang Song finished first in women's 58kg and men's 77kg jerk and Kim Un Ju in women's 75kg jerk and total, adding to the number of gold medals for the country.

articles.title: Table-tennis Contest of Gov't Employees in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Table-tennis Contest of Gov't Employees in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- A table-tennis contest of officials from commissions, ministries and national institutions in the DPRK is now going on at the Pyongyang Indoor Stadium.
					 The contest is held on a team knockout basis, divided into four groups (each grouping 20-odd units). Taking part in the contest are at least 1,000 officials, among them leading party and administration officials of each unit.
					
					 The game is to be decided with the results in men's and women's singles and mixed and men's doubles. 
					
					 The winners in the first-day competition of the contest held on Monday included the State Planning Commission, the Ministry of Railways, the Ministry of External Economic Relations, the Taesong Guidance Bureau, the Guidance Bureau of Sericulture and Silk Industry, the Workers' Party of Korea Publishing House, the Grand People's Study House and the newspaper Chongnyon Jonwi. 
					
					 The contest will last until November 20.

articles.title: Talented Female Footballer
articles.content:
Talented Female Footballer
 Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- Among many talented female footballers in the DPRK is Ra Un Sim of the Amnokgang Sports Team who is active as the captain of the national women's football team.
					 She made a big contribution to her team's access to the first place in the women's football event at the 17th Asian Games.
					
					 She has distinguished herself from others for her teamwork ability, fast running speed and superb scoring ability.
					
					 Kim Kwang Min, chief coach of the team, told KCNA that she is playing a key role in the team.
					
					 Born in Chongjin City, North Hamgyong Province, she began football at her age of 10.
					
					 She participated in the 2006 FIFA U-20 Women's World Cup, the 24th Universiad, the 2013 East Asian Cup, the 6th East Asian Games and other games at which the DPRK team proved successful.
					
					 She was awarded the best player and top scorer prizes at the 2007 Asian U-19 Women's Football Championship by scoring four goals.
					
					 In 2007, the Asian Football Confederation conferred Ra Un Sim the best junior female footballer prize.
					
					 She won the titles of the Kim Il Sung Youth Honor Prize and Merited Athlete in Juche 95 (2006) and the title of the DPRK Labor Hero in October this year.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work on Land Administration Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work on Land Administration Observed
 Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- 30 years have passed since leader Kim Jong Il published the work "On Improving and Strengthening Land Administration".
					 The work, published on Nov. 19, Juche 73 (1984), is a library of the idea and theory on land construction as it made a perfect clarification of the theoretical and practical issues in the socialist land management on the basis of the immortal Juche idea.
					
					 The work comprehensively deals with the essence of the land management in the socialist society, necessity to improve and strengthen it and issues of making overall survey and researches into land and natural resources, carrying out land construction under a plan and doing well the land management, tree planting, road construction and river improvement and protection.
					
					 Kim Jong Il provided an immortal great programme for building socialist land and wisely led the work to implement it.
					
					 He established a well-regulated work system for land management, examined model boards for land construction plans and designs and convened the national meeting of officials in the road sector in May, Juche 75 (1986), the national meeting of activists in the forestry sector in December, Juche 76 (1987) and other meetings, thus making sure that they marked epochal occasions in widely generalizing the achievements and experience gained in this sector and steadily developing them.
					
					 He visited Kangwon Province in May, Juche 87 (1998) and kindled the torch for land alignment. In July of the same year he let the National Defence Commission of the DPRK issue its order on aligning land in Kangwon Province with the whole country involved, seeing to it that the drive for large-scale land alignment raged high.
					
					 He opened a new chapter in the history of irrigation while steering the large-scale land alignment.
					
					 He indicated the orientation and ways of converting the irrigation system in the western part into gravity-fed water supply system and aroused the whole party and army and all people to the drive for the building of a large-scale waterway.
					
					 He paid deep attention to creating, protecting and managing the forests in Korea with lots of mountains.
					
					 Recollecting with deep emotion the efforts made by President Kim Il Sung to create forest resources, he set forth the tasks to turn all mountains into thick woodland through a tree-planting campaign in October and November, Juche 84 (1995).
					
					 He also ushered in a new heyday in road construction, the face of the country and one of the important criteria showing the level of the economic development and civilization.
					
					 In November, Juche 83 (1994) he issued an order of the supreme commander of the Korean People's Army to build Chongryu Bridge (second stage) and Kumrung Tunnel 2 in Pyongyang.
					
					 The great changes that have taken place in the land management over the past three decades are the brilliant fruition of patriotic devotion Kim Jong Il made by unrolling a far-reaching plan and original policy on all fields of this sector and energetically leading the work to implement them.

articles.title: Minju Joson Flays US for Threatening World with Nukes
articles.content:
Minju Joson Flays US for Threatening World with Nukes
 Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- The U.S. together with member countries of NATO staged a drill of dropping nuclear bombs in Italy at the end of last October, according to a magazine of an institute of Canada.
					 Minju Joson Tuesday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 This goes to clearly prove that the U.S. is talking a lot about the non-proliferation of nuclear weapons and "the initiative for building a world without nuclear weapons" but, in actuality, pursuing a world with nuclear proliferation and with nukes.
					
					 The U.S. is chiefly responsible for worldwide nuclear proliferation and the arch criminal disturbing the global peace and stability.
					
					 What is more ridiculous is that the U.S. is making much fuss, labeling those countries opposed to its strategy for monopolizing nukes nuclear criminals and behaving like "a nuclear judge," though it is the worst nuclear criminal more wantonly violating international law and rules on nuclear weapons than any others.
					
					 This reminds one of a thief crying "Stop the thief!"
					
					 The U.S. insists that it is allowed to commit a nuclear crime but other countries are not permitted to conduct just nuclear activities for peace and self-defense. This brigandish logic can never work in this bright world.
					
					 The world is still not free from nuclear instability and horror mainly because of such rogue states as the U.S. which is doing all sorts of wrong things in crude violation of international law.
					
					 The U.S. had better properly reflect on its misconduct and behave itself before pulling up others.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Dismisses S. Koreas' Talk about "Dialogue" Hypocritical
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Dismisses S. Koreas' Talk about "Dialogue" Hypocritical
 Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet warmongers kicked off madcap joint air-strike drill Max Thunder on Nov. 14, timed to  coincide with the DPRK-targeted 2014-Hoguk saber-rattling, the largest-ever, now under way across south Korea.
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in a commentary terms this an unpardonable mockery and vicious challenge to the DPRK's efforts to achieve peace and improve the inter-Korean relations and a deliberate provocation to ignite a new war by driving the situation into a catastrophe.
					
					 The south Korean authorities are paying a lip-service to the north-south dialogue, but the reality goes to clearly prove that they are working hard to do harm to the DPRK by force of arms in collusion with outside forces, the commentary notes, adding:
					
					 It is none other than the south Korean puppet forces who created such tragic situation where the opportunity of improving the north-south relations is being scuppered quite contrary to the expectation and concern of all the Koreans and are escalating the confrontation and tension.
					
					 How can the DPRK negotiate and discuss the issue of mending the relations with such confrontational maniacs?  
					
					  The DPRK declared more than once that dialogue can never go with war drills and there can be neither dialogue nor contact between the north and the south unless the moves to provoke a war against the DPRK are halted.
					
					 The DPRK will never allow the desperate efforts of the group of traitors to do harm to the destiny of the nation and the inter-Korean relations as they are dear to it.
					
					 The puppet warmongers would be well advised to behave themselves, well aware of the surging hatred of the army and people of the DPRK and their strong resolution to wipe them out.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Urges Japan to Settle Its Past Crimes
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Urges Japan to Settle Its Past Crimes
 Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- 109 years have passed since the Japanese imperialists fabricated "Ulsa (1905) Five-point Treaty" in a brigandish way and enforced the fascist colonial rule over Korea in the last century. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says in an article in this regard:
					
					 On November 17, 1905 the Japanese imperialists threatened the Korean feudal government to conclude the "five-point treaty" and on the basis of it they deprived Korea of its diplomatic sovereignty and turned Korea into their colony. 
					
					 Under their colonial rule Korea suffered huge human, material and cultural losses and the Korean people underwent unspeakable misfortune and pain as colonial slaves. 
					
					 Nevertheless, some forces of Japan are still justifying the colonial rule over Korea in the past and talking nonsense that the "Ulsa Five-point Treaty" was "legally" concluded with the Korean feudal government and, accordingly, Japan took over the diplomatic sovereignty of Korea. This is shameless and gangster-like sophism. 
					
					 The "Ulsa Five-point Treaty" was a false document which was fabricated in wanton violation of the requirements and principle of international law and it was unilaterally declared. 
					
					 It is the trend of the times to settle the wrong past. 
					
					 A country sidestepping the issue can hardly win the confidence of the international community and has no future. 
					
					 Japan should bear this in mind and honestly admit the criminal fabrication of the "Ulsa Five-point Treaty" and opt for settling the past crimes.

articles.title: S. Korean Workers Demand Back-to-Work of Sacked Workers
articles.content:
S. Korean Workers Demand Back-to-Work of Sacked Workers
 Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- Members of the Ssangyong Motors branch of the south Korean Metal Workers Union held a protest before the Ssangyong Motors Plant in Phyongtaek, Kyonggi Province on Nov. 15, according to the south Korean online paper Voice of People.
					 Speakers accused the supreme court of ruling that the Motors' indiscriminate dismissal of the workers was "legal" on Nov. 13.
					
					 In the final analysis the court admitted it killed workers again and it was a means to protect the capital, they held. 
					
					 They called for a more dynamic struggle for the reinstatement of the discharged workers.
					
					 They demanded the company authorities work out a plan for reinstating the workers who were subject to disciplinary actions or discharged till the end of November.

articles.title: Fire Breaks out in S. Korea in Unbroken Chain
articles.content:
Fire Breaks out in S. Korea in Unbroken Chain
 Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- There was a fire in a building in Tamyang, South Jolla Province on Nov. 15, according to the MBC of south Korea.
					 It left four people dead and several others wounded.
					
					 A fire broke out in a tire factory in Taejon earlier, causing damage.
					
					 A fire at a hospital in Jangsong, South Jolla Province claimed more than 20 casualties. A fire in a building in Koyang, Kyonggi Province left several people dead.
					
					 The accident in Jangsong was just the same as the fire in Phohang, North Kyongsang Province in 2010. But the puppet authorities took no measure.

articles.title: Koreans in China Urge S. Korea to Stop Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Campaign
articles.content:
Koreans in China Urge S. Korea to Stop Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Campaign
 Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the General Association of Koreans in China issued a statement on Nov. 12 denouncing the south Korean puppet authorities for their anti-DPRK "human rights" campaign.
					 The south Korean puppet authorities are desperately working to hurt the dignity of the DPRK and undermine its socialist system over the non-existent "human rights" issue, the statement noted, adding:
					
					 This is nothing but the reckless act of those who are taken aback by the advantages of the man-centered socialist system and the invincible might of Songun.
					
					 The puppet group's talk about "human rights" is an intolerable challenge to the DPRK and a politically-motivated provocation to incite hostility and mistrust between the fellow countrymen and bedevil the north-south relations.
					
					 The puppet group should bear in mind it will not escape a stern judgment of all Koreans if it persists in its reckless moves to join in outside forces' anti-DPRK "human rights" offensive and hurt compatriots contrary to the trend of the times and the desire of the nation.
					
					 The General Association of Koreans in China and all the Koreans in China will join the people in the homeland in their dynamic actions to frustrate the reckless anti-DPRK "human rights" racket.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should stop at once the foolish "human rights" racket, pondering over the serious consequences to be entailed by the anti-DPRK "human rights" racket.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Off Press in Iran
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Off Press in Iran
 Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Brilliantly Accomplish the Revolutionary Cause of Juche, Holding Kim Jong Il in High Esteem as the Eternal General Secretary of Our Party" was brought out in booklet by the Hadian Publishing House of Iran on the occasion of the 3rd anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The work, published on April 6, Juche 101 (2012), says that it is the principled requirement for victoriously advancing the cause of the Korean revolution to hold Kim Jong Il in high esteem as the eternal general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					
					 It also indicates the tasks to be fulfilled to steadily develop the WPK into the glorious party of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Seminar on Kim Jong Il's Exploits Held in Nigeria
articles.content:
Seminar on Kim Jong Il's Exploits Held in Nigeria
 Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- A Nigerian national seminar on the revolutionary career and immortal exploits of leader Kim Jong Il took place at the Teachers Training College of Abuja on Nov. 6 on the occasion of the 3rd anniversary of his demise.
					 On display in the venue of the seminar were photos documenting his sacred revolutionary career and exploits.
					
					 Also displayed there were works of Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un and books and photos showing the achievements made by the army and people of the DPRK in the building of a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 Present at the seminar were personages of academic circle, chiefs of the groups for the study of the Juche idea and masses.
					
					 Present there on invitation were the DPRK ambassador to Nigeria and staff members of his embassy.
					
					 Gambo Mohamed Hamza, rector of the college, made an opening address.
					
					 Alhassan Mamman Muhammad, chairman of the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, made a keynote report.
					
					 Referring to the sacred revolutionary career of Kim Jong Il, the chairman said it is the most precious legacy left by him for the Korean people and world progressives that he enunciated the Juche idea and the Songun idea as the eternal guiding idea of the DPRK, the guiding idea in the era of independence.
					
					 He developed the Workers' Party of Korea into an invincible guiding force and turned the DPRK into a socialist state centered on the popular masses and the Korean People's Army into a matchless army, the chairman stressed.
					
					 A letter to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the seminar.

articles.title: Beninese Political Party Leader Praises Kim Jong Il's Feats
articles.content:
Beninese Political Party Leader Praises Kim Jong Il's Feats
 Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- Ali Houdou, president of the Socialist Party of Benin, made public a statement on Nov. 11 on the occasion of the 3rd anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 He said:
					
					 We will soon greet the 3rd anniversary of demise of Kim Jong Il, eternal general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and eternal chairman of the National Defence Commission (NDC) of the DPRK.
					
					 The exploits he performed by frustrating the imperialists' aggression, highhanded and arbitrary practices and defending peace and security on the Korean Peninsula with his original Songun politics will go down in history.
					
					 He foiled the U.S. military provocations and every attempt at aggression with his matchless grit and pluck.
					
					 He won a decisive victory in the nuclear showdown with the U.S. under the unfurled banner of Songun after being elected chairman of the NDC, providing a sure guarantee for defending peace not only on the Korean Peninsula and in Northeast Asia but in the rest of the world.
					
					 The undying feats performed by him are always shining thanks to Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the WPK.
					
					 We are firmly convinced that the WPK and the Korean people will defend the sovereignty of the country and global peace and achieve the final victory in the drive for building a thriving socialist nation under the wise guidance of Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered by Asia-Pacific Regional Body
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered by Asia-Pacific Regional Body
 Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- An Asia-Pacific regional committee for honoring the memory of leader Kim Jong Il was inaugurated on November 10.
					 Peter Woods, co-chairman of the Asia-Pacific Regional Committee for Supporting Peaceful Reunification of Korea, Fumihiro Himori, chairman of the Japan Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea, Amar Jit Malhotra, senator from the Pakistan Awami National Party, and Rachmawati Soekarnoputri, chairwoman of the Founding Committee of the Soekarno Foundation for Education of Indonesia, were elected co-chairpersons of the memorial committee.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Pakistan
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Pakistan
 Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- A Pakistani committee for honoring the memory of leader Kim Jong Il was formed in Karachi on Nov. 12.
					 Senator Amar Jit Malhotra was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize a remembrance meeting, lecture, book and photo exhibition and other events across the country on the 3rd anniversary of demise of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Brazilian Organization Introduces Korean People's Successes
articles.content:
Brazilian Organization Introduces Korean People's Successes
 Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- The Brazilian Center for the Study of the Juche Idea posted on its website on Nov. 4 an article titled "Korean people's efforts for the Korean revolution and independence" accompanied with photos of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The article in its preface recalled that the President waged an anti-Japanese armed struggle, achieving the historic cause of national liberation, and led the building of a new society, the anti-imperialist and anti-feudal democratic revolution, the Fatherland Liberation War and socialist revolution and construction to victories.
					
					 It referred to the facts that leader Kim Jong Il protected the sovereignty of the country and the dignity of the nation and put the DPRK on the status of a nuclear weapons state, satellite manufacturer and launcher by enforcing the Songun politics and that Marshal Kim Jong Un has energetically led the Korean people to make eye-opening successes in the drive for building a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 The website in articles titled "Korea under colonial rule, start of Korean revolution" and "New democratic Korea, struggle against U.S. imperialism" praised the undying revolutionary exploits of the President and dealt with the heroic struggle of the Korean people.

articles.title: Guinean Personage Denounces Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Campaign
articles.content:
Guinean Personage Denounces Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Campaign
 Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- Banou Keita, chairman of the Guinea-Korea Friendship Association, made public a statement on Nov. 10 in denunciation of the U.S. and its followers' anti-DPRK "human rights" campaign.
					 The U.S. and its followers are malignantly pulling up the DPRK over its non-existent "human rights issue", the statement said, adding:
					
					 They are distorting the human rights policy, system for ensuring human rights and reality in the DPRK after cooking up a "human rights report".
					
					 The south Korean puppet authorities are making reckless remarks groundlessly slandering the DPRK.
					
					 However, such smear campaign can never work on the DPRK.
					
					 Everything serves the popular masses and human rights are firmly guaranteed in the DPRK, a socialist country where the politics of love for them, the all-embracing politics, is in force. 
					
					 The DPRK had access to strong nuclear deterrence to cope with the U.S. hostile policy toward the former and will further bolster it up.
					
					 The U.S. should bear in mind that it can never bring down the socialist system chosen by the Korean people themselves.
					
					 We, who set store by the friendship with the Korean people, vehemently denounce all sorts of hostile acts to hurt the dignity of the DPRK and its social system.
					
					 We demand the U.S. and its followers stop at once their moves to stifle the DPRK.

articles.title: En Moscu el enviado especial de Kim Jong Un
articles.content:
En Moscu el enviado especial de Kim Jong Un
Moscu, 17 de noviembre (Corresponsal de ACNC) -- El miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico y secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Choe Ryong Hae, llego el dia 17 por avion especial a Moscu para realizar una visita a la Federacion Rusa como enviado especial del Mariscal Kim Jong Un.
					Arribo al aeropuerto tambien su comitiva compuesta por el primer viceministro de Relaciones Exteriores, Kim Kye Gwan, el subjefe del Estado Mayor General del Ejercito Popular de Corea, No Kwang Chol, el subjefe de departamento del Comite Central del PTC, Ri Yong Chol, el viceministro de Relaciones Economicas con el Extranjero, Ri Kwang Gun y otros funcionarios coreanos.
					
					Los visitantes fueron acogidos en el aeropuerto por los funcionarios del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de Rusia y el embajador de la RPDC acreditado en Rusia Kim Hyong Jun.

articles.title: Minju Joson denuncia alboroto nuclear de EE.UU.
articles.content:
Minju Joson denuncia alboroto nuclear de EE.UU.
Pyongyang, 18 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Segun una revista canadiense, a finales de octubre pasado EE.UU. desarrollo junto con los paises miembros de la OTAN los ejercicios de lanzamiento de bombas nucleares en XXX de Italia. 
					Esto demuestra que EE.UU. habla ruidosamente de la no proliferacion nuclear y el "proyecto del mundo libre de armas nucleares", pero, de hecho, preconiza la proliferacion nuclear y el mundo con armas nucleares. 
					
					Revela el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual de este martes y continua:
					
					EE.UU. es el caudillo de la proliferacion nuclear mundial y el perturbador de la paz y estabilidad del mundo. 
					
					Lo mas ridiculo es que este delincuente nuclear infringe al frente la ley y los reglamentos internacionales sobre armas nucleares, mientras tilda atrevidamente de criminales nucleares a los paises que rechazan su estrategia de monopolizacion de armas nucleares actuando como si fuera "juez nuclear". 
					
					Es intolerable la doctrina gangsteril de EE.UU., segun la cual es permisible el crimen nuclear de si mismo, pero no las justas actividades nucleares de otros paises con fines  pacificas y autodefensivas. 
					
					El mundo no esta libre de la inquietud y panico nucleares, debido a algunos paises bribones como EE.UU. que viola brutalmente la ley internacional. 
					
					EE.UU. debe actuar con prudencia antes criticar a otros paises.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun revela caracter enganoso del "dialogo" referido por belicistas surcoreanos
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun revela caracter enganoso del "dialogo" referido por belicistas surcoreanos
Pyongyang, 18 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Coincidiendo con los ejercicios "Hoguk 2014" que se libran en todo el suelo surcoreano contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, los belicistas titeres del Sur de Corea iniciaron el dia 14 el entrenamiento conjunto aereo "Max Thunder".
					El diario Rodong Sinmun, en un comentario individual difundido este martes, senala que esas maniobras militares constituyen un insulto a los esfuerzos de la RPDC por la paz del pais y la mejora de relaciones intercoreanas y una provocacion intencional para desatar nueva guerra llevando a la catastrofe la situacion, y continua:
					
					Aunque las autoridades surcoreanas hablan del dialogo con la RPDC, la realidad comprueba que ellas intentan atacar con fuerzas armadas a la RPDC en contubernio con las fuerzas extranjeras.
					
					Ellas son culpables de la perdida de la oportunidad de mejoramiento de las relaciones intercoreanas y de la agravacion de confrontacion y tension.
					
					La RPDC reitero en varias ocasiones que son incompatibles el dialogo y los ejercicios de guerra y no habra ningun dialogo ni contacto entre ambas partes coreanas mientras prosiga la campana de guerra anti-RPDC.
					
					El ejercito y el pueblo de Corea, que aprecian el destino de la nacion y las relaciones intercoreanas, no perdonaran a la banda de traidores que trata de romperlas a toda costa.
					
					Los belicistas titeres surcoreanos deben actuar con prudencia al conocer bien la voluntad del ejercito y el pueblo de Corea de aniquilar a los enemigos.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun publica articulo al 109o aniversario del "Tratado de 5 Puntos de Ulsa"
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun publica articulo al 109o aniversario del "Tratado de 5 Puntos de Ulsa"
Pyongyang, 18 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Con motivo de que se cumplen los 109 anos desde cuando el imperialismo japones invento de manera bandidesca el "Tratado de 5 Puntos de Ulsa" y comenzo la gobernacion colonial fascista sobre Corea, el diario Rodong Sinmun divulgo hoy un articulo individual que senala como sigue:
					En virtud de ese tratado inventado el 17 de noviembre de 1905 mediante la amenaza y chantaje al gobierno feudal de Corea, el imperialismo japones arrebato los derechos diplomaticos de Corea y la convirtio en su colonia.
					
					Desde entonces, Corea sufrio enormes perdidas humanas, materiales y culturales y el pueblo coreano se vio obligado a vivir como esclavo colonial.
					
					Sin embargo, algunas fuerzas de Japon justifican hasta ahora el coloniaje sobre Corea e insisten en la firma "legal" del "Tratado de 5 Puntos de Ulsa" y el recibo legitimo de los derechos diplomaticos desde el gobierno feudal de Corea.
					
					Evidentemente, el tratado es documento fraudulento que fue inventado violando los principios del derecho internacional y publicado unilateralmente por Japon.
					
					Liquidar el expediente criminal del pasado es la corriente de la epoca.
					
					El pais que desafia a esa tendencia, no puede ganarse la confianza de la sociedad internacional ni tiene el futuro.
					
					Al tenerlo presente, Japon debera reconocer sinceramente la invencion fraudulenta del tratado y liquidar sus crimenes del pasado.
